Description: Small pendant of gold, flat in shape of a cartouche with the sides bent towards the rear, along the sides runs a wire bent to the middle of the cartouche. The thickness of the gold sheet is about 0.05cm. The front of the pendant shows hieroglyphs with incised lines, surrounded by a circumferential line, at the top a winged sun disc, underneath a possible p and a possible 'mn', underneath an 'n'-waterline on top of a 'nb'-basket. Above all a small lug made of a wire with a diameter of 0.1 cm.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
